instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.EDP_BKLT_EN: What is EDP_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “EDP_BKLT” which stands for “embedded displayport backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .
definitions.3V3_S0SW_LCD: What is 3V3_S0SW_LCD? 3V3_S0SW_LCD is a 3.3v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state that powers the LCD screen image circuitry. This is necessary to get an image on the screen.
definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight.
threads.message:
Arrived with very little liquid damage on lcd connector. Works fine with external. 

<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> only .567V

<DIODE>D8410</DIODE> pin 1 0.050V pin2 .567v

<SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> 0V

No short to grounds and already replaced LCD cable. Screen and board connectors look good

PP5V _S0SW_LCD 5V

What next??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> present too?
Do you get image at least?
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> goes high?

I bet for damaged CPU eDP output.
Check diode mode to ground on eDP lines of J8500.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> was 0v Replaced <CHIP>U8501</CHIP> now <SIGNAL>3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> 3.3V

 <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> 3.3v pin 1 <RESISTOR>R4830</RESISTOR> but 0v on pin 2. <RESISTOR>R4830</RESISTOR> measures good.

LookS like <TRANSISTOR>Q4830</TRANSISTOR> needs to be replaced. 

Im assuming <TRANSISTOR>Q4830</TRANSISTOR> cant be replaced from A <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> since this one uses a SSM6N15AFEAP and 00850 uses DMN5L06VK-7

Know any other donars by chance that have the correct chip or sounds like this will have to be special ordered??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight.
threads.message:
When trying a search for  SSM6N15AFEAP  almost nothing comes up. Digikey and mouser also do not have it.

Any idea where this can be ordered if not on any other donars?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight.
threads.message: Yes, checked diode mode to gound on all eDP lines. everything looks good there, no shorts

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight.
threads.message:
looks like mouser has it, should this work even though end of part number slightly different then whats on the schematic?

[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.mouser.com/ProductDetail/Toshiba/SSM6N15AFELM?qs=sRdS99IVWC9N4cCQSvodnA%3D%3D[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight.
threads.message:
Just a dual N channel MOSFET in SOT563 package.
I bet all have the same pin layout.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight.
threads.message:
Don't expect the same voltage for <SIGNAL>XDP_DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> as for <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL>; depends of <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD_MASK</SIGNAL> level.
Do not change <TRANSISTOR>Q4830</TRANSISTOR> without reason.

As you now have <SIGNAL>3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL>, check <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> and backlight output voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight.
